t: A Song to the Lord Who Preserves and Prospers His People
Blessed*pn be*i the Lord*s my Rock, Who*ld trains my hands for war, And*ild my fingers for battle—
My*ld lovingkindness and my fortress, My*ld high tower and my deliverer, My*ld shield and the*i One*i in whom I take refuge, Who*ld subdues my people under me.
Lord,*sln what is*i man, that You take knowledge of him? Or*ild the son of man, that You are mindful of him?
Man*ld is like a breath; His*ld days are*i like a passing shadow.
Bow*ln down Your heavens, O Lord,*s and come down; Touch*ld the mountains, and they shall smoke.
Flash*ld forth lightning and scatter them; Shoot*ld out Your arrows and destroy them.
Stretch*ld out Your hand from above; Rescue*ld me and deliver me out of great waters, From*ld the hand of foreigners,
Whose*ld mouth speaks lying words, And*ld whose right hand is*i a right hand of falsehood.
I*ln will sing a new song to You, O God; On*ld a harp of ten strings I will sing praises to You,
The*ild One*i who gives salvation to kings, Who*ld delivers David His servant From*ld the deadly sword.
Rescue*ln me and deliver me from the hand of foreigners, Whose*ld mouth speaks lying words, And*ld whose right hand is*i a right hand of falsehood—
That*ld our sons may*i be*i as plants grown up in their youth; That*ild our daughters may*i be*i as pillars, Sculptured*ld in palace style;
That*ild our barns may*i be*i full, Supplying*ld all kinds of produce; That*ild our sheep may bring forth thousands And*ld ten thousands in our fields;
That*ild our oxen may*i be*i well laden; That*ild there*i be*i no breaking in or going out; That*ild there*i be*i no outcry in our streets.
Happy*ld are*i the people who are in such a state; Happy*ld are*i the people whose God is*i the Lord!*s
